description.narrative: IFC is considering a US$ 30 million loan to the City of Bogota (the City) for the financing of the construction of Transmicable (Project id. 39772), a 3.4 km aerial cableway that connects Ciudad Bolivar to the Transmilenio Trunk System. The project is expected to benefit approximately 669,000 habitants of Ciudad Bolívar. This project is part of a larger engagement with the City to support the development of the transport system that would include also a US$ 120 million loan to finance the Caracas Sur busway expansion (Project id. 38347).

The Transmicable project is part of a larger IFC engagement with the City of Bogota to support the development of the transport system; this engagement also entails the development of the Caracas Sur busway expansion. The overall expected development impact of this engagement is the following:
1.Project level-outcomes:
-Improved quality of transport service. The projects improve the quality to public transportation services particularly for low income users in Bogota. Transmicable connects a low-income area of the City (Ciudad Bolivar) to the City's main public transport system (Transmilenio BRT) and Caracas Sur entails the provision of exclusive bus lanes to a segment of the BRT network where traffic is currently mixed. The quality improvement will result from reduced congestion and increased frequency of service. Users are expected to save ~8.2 million hours per year (6.2 million Transmicable and 2 million Caracas Sur) which results in approximate savings for users of US$ 18.3 million (US$ 14.7 million Transmicable and US$ 3.6 million Caracas Sur) per year.
-Environmental effect and climate change mitigation. The projects will reduce CO2 emission by approximately 445 tons p.a. on average during operation (134 Transmicable and 311 Caracas Sur) by replacing existing buses fleet and lowering congestion and travel times.
2.Market Creation:
-Integration. The projects will enable the development of new economic activities and clusters. Transmicable is part of an urban renovation project in Ciudad Bolivar. The plan entails the construction of parks, recreation centers and general service centers as well as promotion of businesses, tourism. The project puts in place infrastructure that enables the development of new economic activities (including commercial retail and recreational areas), thereby employment creation and promoting tourism in the area, among other activities.
-Inclusiveness: the projects will continue demonstrating the transformational effect of redeveloping low income urban areas. Transmicable strengthens the evidence that increasing access to markets and services for low income areas generates viable opportunities for private sector participation, economic development and poverty reduction. The projects can serve as a model to be replicated in other low-income areas in Bogota and across Colombia.
